Oh well. All in all we had a great stay, and being able to walk to all the restaurants and the beach was great. Free parking is a great plus as well, although all those huge SUVs and trucks sometimes made parking very tricky. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING RATE FOR SUCH A GREAT GET AWAY EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: travelooo
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely amazing! I went with a friend to get away for a week and can I say how much fun i had just spending majority of the time at the beach (literally 10 steps away from the hotel!) Service was EXCELLENT! Everything was clean and the AC worked perfectly fine. They even let us check in early (10 AM) when check is is supposed to be at 3 or 4. Lovely staff! Just overall a great experience spent in San Diego!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Meli75
Reviews.Content: After searching for hotels, reading reviews, etc. I decided to book a 2 night stay at the Pacific Shores Inn. I booked directly through the hotel website as some of the reviews I read had recommended this and I was able to get a better rate this way. Reviews I had read were mixed which made me a little skeptical, but my friend and I were wanting a place near the beach and the price was right. I must say, we were pleasantly surprised. It looks pretty much like any other smaller scale motel when you arrive, but the lobby has been recently updated and the staff was friendly. We had a first floor room which had recently been remodeled and quite nicely so. The room had two beds, a table and chairs, typical hotel furniture, a walk-in closet with microwave, refrigerator, iron/board, etc. and the bathroom featured ceramic tile, granite, and a glass shower (no tub). The room was clean and pleasant. We also had a table and chairs outside our room on the sidewalk. Location was great, 1/2 block to the beach. Some of the second floor rooms had an ocean view, but we found the ease of parking right outside our door nice. We were right across from the pool also which was nice. I believe they are still in the process of remodeling so you may want to request a room that has already been done. Overall, we had a fun time in Pacific Beach and were pleased with this lodging choice.

Reviews.Title: “Average motel”
Reviews.Author: wolver
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay with Expedia because they had a good deal with a saving of 15%. I have requested a room with 1 king bed per room description and I left a comment requesting a room at the upper level because I read on other reviews that they are bigger than ground leveled rooms. When I got at the h(m)otel I was told that they do not have king beds only queen beds and the ones at the upper level have 2 queen beds therefore are more expensive and that they did not have any left. I was assigned room 11 which is a detached unit by the pool. The room was much smaller, had a dampness smell and it was very noisy (you can hear the neighbours) and first night I could not even go to sleep until 2 am. In the morning there was some construction going on across the street, so, we had to wake up at 7 am. Also, in the room description it is said that there is an internet dial-up access which is not true so beware if you want to use your laptop. For the so-called "breakfast" you'll have just pastries, juice and coffee (small cups). There are no tables to sit to, so you'll have to carry the plate (we had to request for one) to your room. For the price and location the price was good, but I would try to book the hotel through their website and call in advance to make sure I can get a different room. The pool was out of order for the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: AmberWisconsin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great deal - great accomodations for a great price. The beds were comfortable (on the firm side, but very supportive), the bathroom was clean and a nice size (our shower was very spacious), and we had a small refrigerator and microwave in a separate closet room. The hotel is within 500 feet of the beach, close to many restaurants/shops/etc. Parking was free. The outdoor pool was heated and appeared clean and in good condition (we didn't use it, just glanced at it). The only less-than-impressive aspect was the continental breakfast - pastries and juice - but it was still better than nothing! We plan to visit San Diego again and will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: Menelomie
Reviews.Content: Talk about not judging a book by itâ€™s cover! When we initially pulled up to this place I thought it looked like a beat down motel. It was awkward going into the tiny office to check in and then lugging our baggage down to our room. However, upon entering the room Iâ€™d have to say I was very impressed! We stayed on the second floor and we had a mini kitchen, granite counter tops in the kitchen and bathroom, huge beds, vaulted ceilings and tons of living space. Plus, it was a Â½ block down from the beach. Unbelievable rates and perfect location. The breakfast was awkward but it was decent enough. I would highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: tiggerBoston
Reviews.Content: Lovely room - well decorated, new looking and spacious. On the second floor you get high ceilings that are really nice. Toilets seem to run too long but rooms are nice. Free breakfast is not very good - just mini pastry and juice or coffee. But i would return. Location is good, not far from Starbucks, Grocery Store and restaurants. Rooms look like you are spending more on this hotel than you will.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: Katt1
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and were very pleased with the cleanliness, the outstanding staff, and the great location. It's not a 5 star resort but it is the perfect, inexpensive choice for the budget traveler. We will definitely stay here again. If you do stay here, make sure you try the Mexican food at Surf Taco - two blocks away on the same street. It's not fancy but it has fantastic food and incredibly cheap prices. And you can BYOB.

Reviews.Title: “Tough to beat for the price”
Reviews.Author: PeterLibertyvilleIL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while at a conference last month (Jan 08). I stayed in one of the renovated rooms, #57. The room was HUGE, bright and new. Frig, microwave, coffee maker, short walk to the beach. TOTAL for 3 nights with tax was $254. Staff was friendly, recommended restaurants (many to choose from in the area.) HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “softest beds ever, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelsouth01
Reviews.Content: We booked this inn through the hotel website and phoned to confirm (please do). We had booked a 2 bed room. We checked in on Dec 31st and found out that others who had booked through various websites and not confirmed their rooms had no room available. They were very accomodating even on new years eve and referred to another hotel (Holiday Inn La Jolla). Our room was as booked with an amazing amount of space a bar fridge and a mini microwave. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in (including Sheraton Sleep Number) and there would have been enough room for 2 blowup mattresses had we needed it. Room was clean and the staff was amazing. Unfortunately we had to move before we checked out the pool as there was a wild fire in the area and the smoke bothered my asthma (turning on the fan portion of the heater helped somewhat). 1/2 block from the beach with pastries and coffee in the morning was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A great place ... in January.”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinRidgewalker
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip to San Diego for my wife and me and we wanted to experience the fabled Southern California beach culture. We're both in our 60's, so by experience I mean, watch. We stayed for three nights Saturday-Monday after previously staying in Point Loma for three nights. We choose Pacific Shores Inn based on Travel Advisor reviews and the Inn's website. I was somewhat concerned when there was no way to verify my reservation via email (which I made directly by phoning the Inn, since their website did not offer me all the room choices I knew were available.) I wound up calling the Inn prior to leaving on vacation to verify the reservation. Once we arrived everything was exactly as requested. We asked for an upper level 2Q N/S room with kitchen, and a view of the ocean, if possible. The room was huge, with a separate kitchen area and table, a large main room with another table, and a very large walk in closet. The bathroom was above average, but the door was right next to one of the beds. About four rooms shared an outside balcony and each room had its own plastic table and chairs set outside into a little alcove by each room's door. There was a view of the ocean from the balcony, but since the boardwalk and beach was less than a half-block away we simply walked through the parking lot and there it was (except for one other property in front of the Inn). A pleasant surprise was the coin laundry. The Continenal breakfast was the standard rolls, coffee,fruit and juice, but the coffee was very good. One wing of the Inn was being extensively remodeled, the rooms were essentially being gutted and rebuilt. I would strongly suggest that you request an upper level room, and the one's with kitchens don't cost a lot more and appear to be a lot larger. Housekeeping was good, the staff was pleasant (I learned that the motel did not have an internet connection in the office except for the reservation system, which explains the lack of email confirmation.) The Inn is located near the northern end of the beach/boardwalk, which was great because it was less crowded and noisy, yet in a block or two you were right in the middle of the beach scene. We were fortunate to be there when the surf was unusually high and saw high waves, and dozens of surfers up and down the coast. Some of the surfers had come from long distances to take advantage of the waves and a few were staying at the Inn. The weather was perfect, sunny and in the 70's which was what we were seeking after a tough Wisconsin winter. The mid-January price was great , the room was perfect ...... but, I wouldn't want to stay there from Spring Break until the end of the year unless I was much younger, because Pacific Beach is striclty a youth-oriented destination most of the year. We had a few times where the outside noise in the parking lot was excessive, I imagine most of the time the area has a college-town atmosphere. I didn't see any children at the Inn, and almost none in the entire area. Along the boardwalk on the beach bluff there were numerous restaurants and bars, and the shopping area was eclectic. It is a great place to soak up the sun and people-watch, plus you can walk the beach for hours. I would stay there again, at the right time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: pete707
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and had a wonderful stay. Me and a friend drove here all the way from Flagstaff so we were relieved that check-in was quick and easy. Our rooms where huge,with a mini fridge,microwave etc which certainly helped with keeping our beer cool and some snacks warm,the room was one of the older ones but that didn't bother me because you would have a table and chairs outside the room,just perfect to drink a cold one. The location was a massive plus,you're just 2 minutes from the beach,it's only a few minutes from Garnett Blvd where all the bars, shops and restaurants are and about a 40 minute walk to Mission Beach and Belmont Park. I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lao824
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property with three friends this past weekend. For younger adults, this was a great value. Our average nightâ€™s stay was $100 for a room with 2 queen beds and a walk in closet large enough to accommodate a queen sized air mattress, room 23. The mini frig and microwave came in handy. Our room was on a corner on the second floor and had views of the ocean. The staff was helpful, rooms were clean (although it did have a rather unpleasant smell upon entering), parking and complimentary breakfast of pastries, coffee and juice was sufficient. Plus, the location is a very short walk to the beach and only a couple blocks from Garnet Ave, which has a great selection of restaurants, shops and bars. My only complaint is that the shower drained very slowly and sink area was very small. Overall, I will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: CSTCL
Reviews.Content: The room was musty and very unkempt. Cracked tile and calking where water ran down from the shower into the walls. No ammenities in room other than soap and shampoo, paper thin walls, and massive neglect to the room. Felt like a crack-house.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate Price = Moderate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmlax
Reviews.Content: First, San Diego has mostly ma and pa hotel/motel, which may surprise you. All of the "chain" hotels, (Hilton, Sheraton Hyatt etc) are on the bay not on the ocean. Now there are a lot of motels to choose from in San Diego (pacific, mission and imperial beaches), and I researched all of them. The photos on the web showed the motel to be a little out dated, but they all were. This motel offered more amenities that any other motel. They had a pool, offered free breakfast, was walking distance to the beach, and some of the rooms were renovated. (My second choice was the Beach Haven Inn) We booked our reservations 9 months in advance, which it didn't matter upon check-in because we got whatever room was available.(our rate was $119 per night) The front desk was pleasant enough and the room was spacious for being an old beach motel. There had plenty of space for my 2 year to run around. The pool was great, because the wind on the beach was so bad it was nice to dip in the pool. Breakfast was ok, nothing spectacular but I didn't have to pay $10 for a coffee and donut from Starbucks...right? Overall the motel was fine, with the limited choices in San Diego I would recommend this motel to anyone including families. Just remember it is not 5 star, and you get what you pay for....

Reviews.Title: “I suggest staying away from non-renovated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: gmx5050
Reviews.Content: I had the grave misfortune of staying in a non-renovated room. It smelled like B.O., the heater was not working well (this was in the middle of a cold spell) and was loud, and the cable wasn't working. It was basically either freezing cold, really loud or both and I couldn't turn on the TV to drown out the noise b/c nothing was on. I generally found that room to be just disgusting. When I checked another avail. room (also non-renovated), it actually smelled worse. I got comped for my first night's stay - Partially and not fully which I regret not demanding and which I also resent the manager or people who work there for not offering. The manager was elusive with me which I didn't appreciate, but he did talk to someone who worked there and said he would give me a discounted rate at the other property he managed - The Holiday Inn in La Jolla, which turned out to be worlds better. However, if someone had offered this the first night I arrived there, I would've been spared the grossness of staying there at all. I was too tired and busy to switch at the time. I had a great time in SD anyway, but I just hope this may be helpful to someone somehow. I had was extremely uncomfortable and just gross. IMO, they should pay YOU to stay in those rooms.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Pacific Shores Inn”
Reviews.Author: kjh61
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Shores Inn is a great place to stay. It was inexpensive, by far the cheapest in the area, the staff was friendly and helpful and it was immaculately clean. It takes about 2 minutes to walk from the room to the ocean and a 5 minute walk to the Crystal Pier. The pool was freezing but the Pacific was colder. The bathroom in our room was cramped with not a lot of space to put your stuff. There was more than enough lighting and the beds were comfy with new pillows & mattresses. Ask for a renovated room, they are the ones with new beds. The surrounding area felt safe, we walked around at night and were not harassed or approached by anyone. Since most of the restaurants and things to do are in walking distance we didn't need the car at all! Pacific Shores Inn is my favorite place to stay in Pacific Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: HP33
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel!! It has an amazing location (a block from Pacific Beach, dining and shopping)! The room itself is a very good size, huge closet, very clean. It also comes with a mini fridge and microwave making it easy to keep leftovers of all the great Mexican food in the area. The rooms also seemed quiet as the hotel appeared to be full and we never heard any disturbances. The pool is very nice, no hot tub though. I would highly recomend this Hotel to anyone traveling on a budget who still wants to be in a great location and stay in a clean bed. I will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: softiegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December 2006. Pros: - Good location (close to the Beach). - Nice small Pool - Clean Room - Good Price Cons: - Some TV stations didn't work well - Breakfast didn't look too good (we didn't touch it) Overall i would stay here again in the future. It was a basic hotel, but still nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bambygirl
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal location for sightseeing and the beach is beautiful right around the corner. The room was dated but very clean, the only downside was that we had a room with another room above us, not good. The clomping of feet went on and on and the voices could be heard even tho they weren't talking loud. If I ever go back I would definitely ask for a room either on the second floor or one that doesn't have another floor. Other than that we had a wonderful time here, watched the surfers constantly and the boardwalk next to the hotels was wonderful and Joe's Crabshack was a nice walk. Kono's for breakfast is a must even if its busy. The hotel is only 8 miles from the airport and really close to Seaworld, Old Town, LaJolla 10 minutes up the road, and the signs to downtown San Diego are very easy especially to Gaslamp, Seaport Village, and the harbor cruises. We were here for 2 weeks from MA and really enjoyed the area.

Reviews.Title: “Sshhh, Keep This Place a Secret!”
Reviews.Author: MMPJMH
Reviews.Content: This is the best kept secret in all of San Diego's Pacific Beach! Guest Service Manager Karla Jauregui and her assistant Frank make you feel like you're somewhere that should cost twice the price. The pool is sparkling clean, linens are plentiful (even poolside), the morning coffee and pastries are a delight and even though all 56 units were filled, it's as quiet as a walk in the woods. Other reviewers talk about trying to get one of the renovated units, but my wife and I found the older rooms more desirable -- because you had a patio table and chairs right outside your door in a shaded area. The bus stop is in front of the hotel and just ask Karla or Frank for directions, they'll get you right to wherever you want to go. There was only one downside to the whole Pacific Shores Inn experience: Ultimately, you have to pack up and go home. -- MP, Santa Monica CA

Reviews.Title: “A nice motel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: KayD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in September, while travelling around the west coast. We booked direct with the hotel and paid $400 for 5 nights, an offer rate for booking on the website. The first room we were given was a bit old fashioned but ok, we stayed their one night. The next morning the girl on reception was horrified to hear we didn't have a fridge in our room and quickly moved us to another room which was much nicer, and had a kitchen, large seating area, a large newly decorated bathroom. I beleive these rooms were more expensive but we were not charged any extra. The Motel is situated one block back from the beach, and on the main road through Pacific Beach, a short walk from many restaurants, bars, surf shops etc. Pacific Beach is a lovely surf town just outside San Diego, although it was busy with students at the weekend. For UK users think Newquay, Cornwall, but on the Pacific coast!! Overall I would recommend this Motel, if you can get one of the large rooms as we did. The staff were very helpful, and the rooms were clean. There is also a laundry room on site.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to ask for a renovated room...”
Reviews.Author: blondebeth27
Reviews.Content: We paid about $115 a night, which was good for San Diego in June, but our room was not very nice. Apparently we got stuck in one of the rooms that hadn't been renovated yet, though we didn't find that out till late in our trip so we couldn't really ask to move. I heard the other rooms are much nicer. Ours was kind of falling apart. The walls were incredibly thin, and I was kept awake by the snoring from the next room. The bathroom was tiny and walls were crumbling. The room felt kind of dirty. There was no hairdryer in the room like I had expected. The breakfast, too, was a disappointment--just a table of pastries in the office. The location was great, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: taraj6
Reviews.Content: PAcific SHores INn was a great find. The price was unbeatable for the location right on the beach. The Mission Bay area of San Diego is great for those who like water sports and outdoor activities. It is close to all major road ways and was easy to find. The room was small but clean and cared for. The staff was approachable and the free breakfast was key. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone on a budget looking to stay ocean front.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: katiewSurpriseAZ
Reviews.Content: We got our room for $110/night thru the hotels website. The rooms were nicely decorated with granite countertops, a kitchenette, and plenty of room for our family of 5. It was very convienent for us to be so close to the beach with 3 young children. It literally took us about 2 minutes to get down by the water. I never heard any noises coming from any of the rooms around us, but I know there were people staying in those rooms as the hotel was booked full. I will be checking this hotel for our next trip to San Diego. The front desk staff was also very polite and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: mamabear04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The room was large which was nice, Having the kitchen fully stocked with dishes was a bonus. For newly renovated, the couch had holes and our feet were black from the carpet if we did not wear shoes. There is not enough parking for the units unless most of the rooms had more than one car. We were always on the side street. I was also charged more than my confirmation quoted but my check out clerk would not change it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Resepiraterna
Reviews.Content: Right by the sea. Clean and comfortable. Great breakfast if you like pasteries. Would absolutely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: portia916
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in Pacific Beach before at the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge. I loved the area and was looking to return to the area at a more affordable price. Booking on the Pacific Shoes Inn website, we paid an average of $87 dollars a night! I was a bit hesitant because of some of the other reviews on this site, but everything turned out fine. At check-in, I asked about whether or not all the rooms had been updated. It was explained that all of the rooms have been updated within the past 6 years and that only a portion of the rooms have been updated within the last year. We were given one of the rooms that was updated 6 years ago, which actually had a great partial ocean view. Sure, the bathroom could have been bigger and updated, but the room was clean. We didn't partake in the continental breakfast, but there are plenty of local and chain restaurants within walking distance and the beach is literally a 15 second walk away. I also enjoyed being at the quieter end of the promenade. I would definitely stay here again. Sure it's not a 4-star hotel, but we knew that going in.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PRICE/GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ocaseyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pacific Shores Inn on our recent trip to San Diego, and no complaints!! GREAT prices!! Even BETTER location!! Walked to the ocean every morning to see the dolphins, and then got breakfast at Konoâ€™s CafÃ© or Taco Surf. (YOU HAVE TO VISIT THOSE RESTURANTS!!) The hotel also offers a free breakfast, but we never went. Pool was small, didnâ€™t even use itâ€¦ Go to the ocean!! Walking distance to Garnett where all the stores and bars are. Didnâ€™t spend much time in the room, basically just slept thereâ€¦ very clean, service was great. I love San Diego. Would defiantly suggest for 20-somethings, young couples and families looking for a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/ Average motel”
Reviews.Author: lori22
Reviews.Content: We also read the reviews, but was a little disappointed with the room. They recently remodeled the rooms, but should have gone the extra mile and updated the bathrooms.. I am 5'9" and the shower head was 5'3". Works well if you are 10 years old. We also had several nights of no sleep between 1 a.m. and 3 a.m. called the night manager. but no luck... the day manager told me if we wanted we should just call the police. His advise came a day to late, we were checking out. The location is wonderful!! but the motel is old and the walls are very thin... If you are looking for a cheap place to shower and get a few winks of sleep.. this is your place.

HotelInfo.Name: Pacific Shores Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 4802 Mission Blvd., San Diego, CA 92109
